content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at ≈ (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following connected entities:
• Input chest at (2.5, 17.5) serving as the factory’s material interface.
• Burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5) retrieved in an early step.
• Dedicated burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5) (placed using direction RIGHT) that works in tandem with the input chest.
• Assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5) that processes items within the factory setup.

### Extraction System at (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
• Extraction system burner inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5) used as the source for moving copper plates.

### Depot Belt System at ≈ (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following connected entities:
• Wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5) crafted and placed to serve as an isolated belt depot.
• Transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5) positioned adjacent to the depot chest.
• Depot burner inserter at (3.5, 14.5) (placed using direction UP) featuring a pickup position at (3.5, 15.5) and a drop position at (3.5, 13.5) that is intended to receive items from the extraction system.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors (Steps 210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, 217)
  – When connecting multi‐segment transport belts, the target was mistakenly identified as a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always ensure the target entity is an inserter (or an entity accepting items) rather than a steam engine.

• Entity Placement Distance Error (Step 212)
  – The wooden chest placement failed because the target position (3.5, 15.5) was too far from the player’s position (0, 0). Move closer to the target location before attempting to place the entity.

• Inventory Shortage Error (Step 213)
  – Failed placement of the wooden chest occurred due to its absence in the inventory. Verify that the required entity is available in inventory before placement.

• Variable Reference Error (Step 212)
  – A NameError occurred because of an undefined variable ('target_chest'). Double-check variable names and ensure that references match the defined variables.
